intro: Galium nupercreatum, commonly known as the early evening bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Galium nupercreatum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
